TA0001.name: Initial Access
TA0001.description: The adversary is trying to get into your network.

TA0002.name: Execution
TA0002.description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

TA0003.name: Persistence
TA0003.description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold.

TA0004.name: Privilege Escalation
TA0004.description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

TA0005.name: Defense Evasion
TA0005.description: The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.

TA0006.name: Credential Access
TA0006.description: The adversary is trying to steal account names and passwords.

TA0007.name: Discovery
TA0007.description: The adversary is trying to figure out your environment.

TA0008.name: Lateral Movement
TA0008.description: The adversary is trying to move through your environment.

TA0009.name: Collection
TA0009.description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal.

TA0010.name: Exfiltration
TA0010.description: The adversary is trying to steal data.

TA0011.name: Command and Control
TA0011.description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised systems to control them.

TA0040.name: Impact
TA0040.description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your systems and data.

T1566.name: Phishing
T1566.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems.

T1059.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
T1059.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.

T1547.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution
T1547.description: Adversaries may configure system settings to automatically execute a program during system boot or logon.

T1055.name: Process Injection
T1055.description: Adversaries may inject code into processes in order to evade process-based defenses.

T1003.name: OS Credential Dumping
T1003.description: Adversaries may attempt to dump credentials to obtain account login and credential material.

T1082.name: System Information Discovery
T1082.description: An adversary may attempt to get detailed information about the operating system and hardware.

T1021.name: Remote Services
T1021.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a service specifically designed to accept remote connections.

T1005.name: Data from Local System
T1005.description: Adversaries may search local system sources, such as file systems and configuration files or local databases.

T1041.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
T1041.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command and control channel.

T1071.name: Application Layer Protocol
T1071.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering.

T1486.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
T1486.description: Adversaries may encrypt data on target systems or on large numbers of systems in a network.

T1190.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
T1190.description: Adversaries may attempt to take advantage of a weakness in an Internet-facing computer or program.

T1105.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
T1105.description: Adversaries may transfer tools or other files from an external system into a compromised environment.

T1133.name: External Remote Services
T1133.description: Adversaries may leverage external-facing remote services to initially access and/or persist within a network.

T1218.name: System Binary Proxy Execution
T1218.description: Adversaries may bypass process and/or signature-based defenses by proxying execution of malicious content with signed binaries.

S0154.name: Cobalt Strike
S0154.description: Cobalt Strike is a commercial, full-featured, penetration testing tool which bills itself as 'adversary simulation software designed to execute targeted attacks'.

S0002.name: Mimikatz
S0002.description: Mimikatz is a credential dumper capable of obtaining plaintext Windows account logins and passwords.

S0363.name: Empire
S0363.description: Empire is an open source, cross-platform remote administration and post-exploitation framework.

S0349.name: LaZagne
S0349.description: LaZagne is a post-exploitation, open-source tool used to recover stored passwords on a system.

S0029.name: PsExec
S0029.description: PsExec is a free Microsoft tool that can be used to execute a program on another computer.

S0039.name: Net
S0039.description: The Net utility is a component of the Windows operating system.

S0482.name: Bundlore
S0482.description: Bundlore is adware that can infect macOS systems.

S0363.name: Empire
S0363.description: Empire is an open source, cross-platform remote administration and post-exploitation framework.

S0266.name: TrickBot
S0266.description: TrickBot is a Trojan spyware program that has mainly been used for targeting banking sites.

S0650.name: QakBot
S0650.description: QakBot is a trojan that is typically used to steal credentials and banking information.

S0570.name: BitPaymer
S0570.description: BitPaymer is ransomware that has been used in targeted attacks.

S0089.name: BlackEnergy
S0089.description: BlackEnergy is a trojan that has been used by both criminal actors and APT groups.

G0016.name: APT29
G0016.description: APT29 is threat group that has been attributed to Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service.

G0007.name: APT28
G0007.description: APT28 is a threat group that has been attributed to Russia's General Staff Main Intelligence Directorate (GRU) 85th Main Special Service Center (GTsSS) military unit 26165.

G0050.name: APT32
G0050.description: APT32 is a suspected Vietnam-based threat group that has been active since at least 2014.

G0004.name: Ke3chang
G0004.description: Ke3chang is a threat group attributed to actors operating out of China.

G0040.name: Lazarus Group
G0040.description: Lazarus Group is a North Korean state-sponsored cyber threat group that has been attributed to the Reconnaissance General Bureau.

G0067.name: APT37
G0067.description: APT37 is a North Korean state-sponsored cyber espionage group that has been active since at least 2012.

G0114.name: Chimera
G0114.description: Chimera is a China-based threat group that has been active since at least 2018.

G0035.name: Dragonfly
G0035.description: Dragonfly is a cyber espionage group that has been attributed to Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) Center 16.
